channel.title: H4x0r88's Mac OSX #317 client
channel.description:
[size=30pt]First of all, DO NOT flame/talk about which operating system is better! Honestly, that's your opinion NOT mine![/size] [size=25pt]PLEASE, DO NOT ASK FOR MORE PICTURES! It will just piss me off![/size] [b][size=20pt]This is the only client I've ever seen that will actually run on a mac, without crashing when "null items" are introduced![/size][/b] I will only be supplying one picture, for one reason, to prove that it actually runs on a Mac. [IMG]http://i33.tinypic.com/34nk6zp.png[/img]
[color=orange][center][b][u]Features[/u][/b][/center] [center]-Godsword stances -Custom items -Run and compile for Mac OSX -Custom sprites -Stability[/center]
Sorry about the file size, the sprites make the client big. The client is set to localhost, you can change that in the .java files.
This has been tested on:(Tell me if it worked on any other Operating system versions. ;)) Snow Leopard Leopard
[size=30pt]If you download, I'd love for you to speak your mind! ;)[/size]
[b]Special thanks to: Me JaGeX SilentCJ (G.S. stances) Java.com Moparscape.org Moparisthebest.com Apple Inc.[/b]
Download: [url=http://www.megaupload.com/?d=AIOB5VEA]http://www.megaupload.com/?d=AIOB5VEA[/url]

item.title: H4x0r88's Mac OSX #317 client
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“m.dog311, post:63, topic:305287”][quote author=eyeownyew link=topic=401532.msg3710939#msg3710939 date=1313349657]

‘Mac’ clients are stupid and useless, not because they run on a Mac, but because it’s written in Java, the same client should run on Windows, Mac, Linux, anything that has a JVM? Why doesn’t it? The runescape client does, and so does the MoparScape client.

My guess would be all the hard coded shit, like the cache directory.

Look at the OP post date facepalm
[/quote]
It was on the front page…[/quote]
And it’s still on the front page because all of you are helping to bump it. Then, this occurs: [quote=“lemuralex, post:65, topic:305287”]Hey! I was using this but whenever I try to login I just get something sayin “Error connecting to server”. How do I fix this? I havent set up anything else, just installed this and ran the “Run” file. A link to a tut would be fine. Btw, I’m not makin a public server just one for me to use on my cpu. Thanks![/quote]

Read full topic

@lemuralex wrote:

Hey! I was using this but whenever I try to login I just get something sayin “Error connecting to server”. How do I fix this? I havent set up anything else, just installed this and ran the “Run” file. A link to a tut would be fine. Btw, I’m not makin a public server just one for me to use on my cpu. Thanks!

item.title: H4x0r88's Mac OSX #317 client
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“m.dog311, post:59, topic:305287”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=401532.msg3710923#msg3710923 date=1313349288]
‘Mac’ clients are stupid and useless, not because they run on a Mac, but because it’s written in Java, the same client should run on Windows, Mac, Linux, anything that has a JVM? Why doesn’t it? The runescape client does, and so does the MoparScape client.
[/quote]
My guess would be all the hard coded shit, like the cache directory.[/quote]
You can ‘hard code’ it, just use ‘user.dir’ or similar, so it works on all systems.

Read full topic

It wont run - this is all i get in terminal after i compile then try to run.

[code=boo]Last login: Fri Sep 3 00:04:54 on ttys000
Admin-Nick-macbook:~ Nick$ /Users/Nick/Desktop/MacOSX317client/Run ; exit;
Exception in thread “main” java.lang.UnsupportedClassVersionError: Bad version number in .class file
at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(ClassLoader.java:676)
at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(SecureClassLoader.java:124)
at java.net.URLClassLoader.defineClass(URLClassLoader.java:260)
at java.net.URLClassLoader.access$100(URLClassLoader.java:56)
at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:195)
at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:188)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:317)
at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:280)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:252)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(ClassLoader.java:375)
logout

[Process completed][/code]
